document.docAuthor: Castro-Vargas, Maria I., Morales, Irina & Molano-Rendón, Fredy
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Metrobates Uhler, 1871 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) from Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Metrobates Uhler, 1871 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) from Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Apterous male ( Fig. 1b ): measurements (n= 10): Body: length 3.76, maximum width 1.92. Head: length 0.49, width 0.70, interocular distance 0.48. Lengths of antennal segments I–IV 1.31 , 0.38, 0.29, 0.39. Rostrum length 0.73. Thorax: pronotum length 0.44. Legs segments lengths (femur, tibia, tarsomere I, tarsomere II): foreleg 1.50, 0.87, 0.11, 0.38; midleg 2.97, 5. 60, 0.74, 1.26; hindleg 5.10, 1. 57, 0.15, 0.47.

Color . Head black with a V-shaped interocular reddish brown stripe ( Fig. 1b ). Antennal segment I with basal quarter reddish brown and distal three quarters dark brown; antennal segments II–IV brown with golden pubescence. Pronotum light green with apical black patch on each side. Mesonotum black, light green medially, and a longitudinal light green stripe on each side, stripe completely covering the anterior region of mesonotum and reaching mesoacetabulum; mesopleuron black. Metanotum and mediotergite I black with light green spot on each side. Thorax green ventrally. Fore femur with basal region reddish brown, distal region dark brown; fore tibia and tarsus dark brown. Mid- and hindlegs dark brown. Mediotergites II–IV light green; V–VI light green with a black spot distally; VII mostly black with a green spot on anterior margin; VIII dark green. Abdominal laterotergites light green, except for last one entirely dark green.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Parameres of: a.
Metrobates sanciprianensis
sp. nov.
; b.
Metrobates amblydonti
; c.
Metrobates fugientis
; d.
Metrobates porcus
Anderson, 1932
(Redrawing from Anderson, 1932).

subSubSection.paragraph: Apterous female measurements (n= 10). Body: length 3.57, maximum width 2.11. Head: length 0.49, width 0.57, interocular distance 0.44; Lengths of antennal segments I–IV: 1.0 8, 0.37, 0.28, 0.36. Rostrum length 0.76. Thorax: pronotum, length 0.42. Leg segments lengths (femur, tibia, tarsomere I, tarsomere II): foreleg 1.39, 0.98, 0.13, 0.40; midleg 2.87, 5. 60, 0.70, 1.23; hindleg 4.86, 1. 45, 0.16, 0.48.

Similar to male in color and structure, but differs by: antennal segment I slightly narrower in basal region with two long setae on ventral surface, antennal segments II and III without small tufts of short, erect setae in apical region. Mesoacetabulum without tooth-shaped projection. Fore tibia with a row of short setae on lateral margin and without triangular apical projection.

Diagnosis.
M. amblydonti
is similar to
M. porcus Anderson
but differs from it by the shape of the male paramere. The paramere of male of
M. amblydonti
is broadly widened medially and the apical region is pointed ( Fig. 3b ), whereas
M. porcus
presents the paramere bilobed in the basal region and the apical region is more rounded ( Fig. 3d ).

Known distribution. COLOMBIA: Amazonas, Antioquia, Caquetá, Casanare, Cesar, Córdoba, Norte de Santander, Putumayo, Quindío, Valle del Cauca and Vichada. ( Aristizábal 2002 ,
Molano-Rendón et al. 2005
, Padilla-Gil 2013 , Padilla-Gil 2014 ). This is the first record of
M. amblydonti
for the departments of Cauca, La Guajira and Risaralda ( Fig. 5 ).
